pages.title: Steam Boiler
pages.text: The <item>Steam Boiler/$ produces <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/fluid)steam/$ using <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/heat)heat/$ and water. It can also produce <item>salt/$ as a byproduct, but only if using water instead of <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/fluid)distilled water/$.$(br2)It has a minimum temperature of 100Â°C, but produces steam faster at higher temperatures. The efficiency is the

same at all temperatures. There is a <item>$(l:essentials:heat/cable)heat cable/$ connection on the bottom, water/<thing>$(l:essentials:intro/fluid)distilled water/$ is piped in the sides, and <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/fluid)steam/$ comes out the top.$(br2)<item>Salt/$ produced as a byproduct of using regular water instead of <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/fluid)distilled water/$ can not be piped/hoppered out, and will clog up the <item>boiler/$ if not removed- using <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/fluid)distilled water/$ is therefore

important for automation.$(br2)<thing>$(l:essentials:intro/fluid)Steam/$ can be used to generate power both as <item>$(l:essentials:heat/radiator)heat/$ or <item>$(l:essentials:rotary/turbine)rotary/$. Doing this will output <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/fluid)distilled water/$, regardless of what liquid was used to make the <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/fluid)steam/$. <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/fluid)Distilled water/$ can also be produced in a <item>$(l:essentials:fluid/centrifuge)water centrifuge/$.$(br2)
